                     java.lang.String[] cmds)

        Returns:
        the output of the external application

      • ShellTimed

        public java.lang.String ShellTimed(java.io.File file,
                          java.lang.String[] cmds,
                          long timeLimit,
                          int interval)
        See Shell above. This adds a timelimit to the external application request and can alter check interval
        Parameters:
        file - the external aplication file (used to access location)
        cmds - instructions to give external application (using ProcessBuilder)
        timeLimit - maximum amount of time (in seconds) that the external application is allowed to run
        interval - time between checking if external process is alive
        Returns:
        the output of the external application

        public void Write(java.io.File file,
         java.lang.String str,
         boolean append)
        Method to write String to a File, with option to append or overwrite.
        Parameters:
        file - the File to be written to
        str - the String to written
        append - whether to append to File (true) or overwrite (false)

      • FastTree

        public java.lang.String FastTree(java.lang.String alignfilein,
                        java.lang.String treefileout)
        Allows FastTree support. The alignment file should be in the same folder as the FastTree application. FastTree commands are "FastTree -nt -gtr -nosupport -out TREE_FILE ALIGNMENT_FILE"
        Parameters:
        alignfilein - the name of the alignment file used as FastTree input
        treefileout - the name of the tree file used as FastTree output
        Returns:
        FastTree output is returned. Useful for error-checking.

      • convertFile

        public void convertFile(java.lang.String filein,
               java.lang.String endline)
        Converts a file to a OS-compatible line-ending character, while making a backup of the original (ending with .bak).
        Parameters:
        filein - name of file (should be located under Input folder)
        endline - the character to end each line with (Linux: \n)

      • convertNames

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> convertNames(java.lang.String alignmentName,
                                                            java.lang.String endline)
        Converts names of alignment to a hash-related String because not all characters are compatible with HYPHY. Writes mapped conversions to file under Input folder with "_CODES" at end of the name. Also converts a file to a OS-compatible line-ending character, while making a backup of the original (ending with .bak).
        Parameters:
        alignmentName - name of alignment file (should be located under Input folder)
        endline - the character to end each line with (Linux: \n)
        Returns:
        a Map of which hash-related String corresponds to each actual sequence.

      • getNameCodes

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getNameCodes(java.lang.String alignmentName)
        Method to retrieve the mapped sequence names to their corresponding hash-related Strings located in an appropriately named file (ending with "_CODES.txt").
        Parameters:
        alignmentName - name of alignment file (should be located under Input folder)
        Returns:
        a Map of which hash-related String corresponds to each actual sequence.

      • getTreeLine

        public java.lang.String getTreeLine(java.lang.String filename)
        Method to input tree in line form (.nwk)
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file for which tree must be extracted (located under Input folder)
        Returns:
        tree in String format

      • HyphyResults

        public java.lang.String[] HyphyResults(java.util.List<java.lang.String> trees,
                              java.lang.String alignfilename)
        Default HyphyResults call which assumes single-threaded approach. See HyphyResults below.
        Parameters:
        trees - collection of trees to test using HYPHY script
        alignfilename - name of alignment file (must be located under Input folder)
        Returns:
        output from each SchmodelTest.bf HYPHY script is in a single array. If errors occur during method an empty array is returned.

      • HyphyResults

        public java.lang.String[] HyphyResults(java.util.List<java.lang.String> trees,
                              java.lang.String alignfilename,
                              int multi)

      • HyphyResults

        public java.lang.String[] HyphyResults(java.util.List<java.lang.String> trees,
                              java.lang.String alignfilename,
                              int multi,
                              int threadpool)
        Calls SchmodelTest.bf HYPHY script using Shell method for each tree in a collection. HYPHY program and SchmodelTest.bf script must be located under HYPHY folder.
        Parameters:
        trees - collection of trees to test using HYPHY script
        alignfilename - name of alignment file (must be located under Input folder)
        multi - whether approach should be single-threaded (0), multithreaded quick (1) or multithreaded with progress (2)
        threadpool - number of threads to be used. By default (0), thead pool is number of CPUs (virtual included).
        Returns:
        output from each SchmodelTest.bf HYPHY script is in a single array. If errors occur during method an empty array is returned.

      • HYPHYAlignmentReplace

        public java.lang.String HYPHYAlignmentReplace(java.lang.String alignfilename)
        Converts some characters in sequence names. Deprecated by convertName method
        Parameters:
        alignfilename - name of alignment file
        Returns:
        corrected String

      • outputIndividualTrees

        public void outputIndividualTrees(java.util.List<java.lang.String> trees,
                         java.lang.String filename)
        Generated trees are output to indivudal single line files That is, each rerooted tree exists in a unique .nwk tree file within a folder named after the original filename
        Parameters:
        trees - the collection of trees to output
        filename - the folder to which the trees will be output to

      • outputTrees

        public void outputTrees(java.util.List<java.lang.String> trees,
               java.lang.String filename)
        Displays a list of trees in a defined file name, with a header The trees are those from the Input folder
        Parameters:
        trees - the collection of trees to output
        filename - the name of the file that trees will be output to

      • getRoots

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRoots(java.io.File rootFile)
        Returns a list of trees that have already been rooted from a File
        Parameters:
        rootFile - File where trees are located
        Returns:
        a list of every tree

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty(java.io.File file)
        Checks whether File is empty (true) or has content (false). Only checks if first line of File contains no characters.
        Parameters:
        file - File to be checked
        Returns:
        true if empty, false if first line contains something

      • listFilesForFolder

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> listFilesForFolder(java.lang.String ending,
                                                  java.io.File folder)
        Every file within a folder (including folders within that) is put into a Collection, but only if the file ends with an appropriate ending.
        Parameters:
        ending - applicable endings of files (separated by ",")
        folder - the folder to have listed
        Returns:
        a collection of Strings with file names

      • deleteDirectory

        public static boolean deleteDirectory(java.io.File directory)
        A directory and every file/folder within it is deleted
        Parameters:
        directory - directory to be deleted
        Returns:
        true if deleted, false otherwise

      • Log

        public void Log(java.lang.String str)
        Logs a String preceded by the date and time using JTextArea and JScrollPane. Also outputs to the Log.txt file using logFile and also an alignment-specific log file if applicable.
        Parameters:
        str - String to be logged

      • setNextAlignment

        public void setNextAlignment()
        The next alignment is gotten from the combo box. Must be called before getNextAlignment. Could also implement a listener of combobox, but unnecessary for now.

      • getNextAlignment

        public java.lang.String getNextAlignment()
        Retrieves the next alignment and sets it as the current alignment being processed
        Returns:
